cyclone.name: BILL
cyclone.current_location: about 155 miles SSE of Galveston, Texas
cyclone.trajectory: moving northwest toward the central Texas coast and then inland across south-central Texas
cyclone.expected_landfall_location: near Port O’Connor / Matagorda Bay, TX

weather_observation.warning_coast: Baffin Bay to High Island, Texas
weather_observation.impacted_coast: Entire upper and middle Texas coast, including Galveston Bay and Houston-Galveston area
weather_observation.wind: Sustained tropical storm-force winds up to 50 mph with higher gusts possible in and near Galveston Bay.
weather_observation.storm_surge: 2–4 ft surge forecast along the upper Texas coast, including Galveston Bay and channels serving Houston Port.
weather_observation.rainfall: Widespread 4–8 inches with isolated totals up to 12 inches, producing flash flooding potential around the port complex.
weather_observation.other_hazards: Fresh-water flooding of access roads/rail, possible temporary shipping channel closures, and reduced visibility in squalls.
